meanings.definition: Acting in a sly or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat was sneakier than the dog when stealing treats.
meanings.sent2: She became sneakier in her attempts to avoid doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The sneakier squirrel managed to grab the last acorn before the others noticed.
meanings.sent4: His sneakier tactics in the game made him the champion.
meanings.sent5: The sneakier fox outsmarted the hunters and escaped into the woods.

meanings.definition: More devious or underhanded than others.
meanings.sent1: The sneakier salesman managed to sell faulty products to unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent2: As the competition grew, his tactics became sneakier to stay ahead.
meanings.sent3: The sneakier student tried to copy answers during the test without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: Her sneakier plan to win the election surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sneakier spy obtained classified information without anyone noticing.
